options.text: Both <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text: Photophosphorylation is the synthesis of ATP from ADP and inorganic phosphate in the presence of light. When two photosystems work in a series, first PS II and then PS I, a process called noncyclic photophosphorylation occurs. When only PS I is functional, the electron is circulated within the photosystem and phosphorylation occurs due to cyclic flow of electrons, it is cyclic photophosphorylation.
